oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Knoxville College, original building
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Schools
African American universities and colleges; Knoxville College (Knoxville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-story brick building, with above-ground basement and central bay entrance cupola, on landscaped grounds with curved walkway lined with small trees, surrounded by white plank fence next to a cleared farm field.

Knoxville College historian Robert Joseph Booker, a 1962 graduate, is the author of "And There was Light: The 120-year History of Knoxville College, 1875-1995." The building pictured here was the college's first building, dedicated September 6, 1876.
